lines.text: [first lines]
Ben should have been back hours ago. I hope he didn't have any trouble filing those papers.
Not as much trouble as we're going to have when we ride into Soledad.
Now that Ben's dead, you own all that land around Thousand Springs.
Doesn't do you much good if you're six feet under it.
Your friend is a relic of a wilder West. He walks among ghosts, the same as me.

[to Ross]
Now that you've looked me over, would you like to examine my teeth for age?
You lookin' for a job? I need an extra hand out at the Box N.
Cowhand or gunhand?
We can use both in this valley.
Join up with Reynolds, you'll be buckin' Jack Foyle. He's one of my men.
Foyle the best you got?
You want to face him?
You can't face him. He always waits until your back is turned.
Room?
The best you got.
Take your pick - there'll all bad.
You know, I've only had three close friends in my day.
Oh? Who were they?
Two guns and a horse.
Payne and Reynolds ran all the little ranchers off the range and they kept 'em off with lead. What do you plan to use for ammunition?
Water.
I'll take care of Haney - for nothin'!
That's why you ain't a success. You work too cheap.
[Ross examines Sherry's ringless ring finger]
Don't you ever get through examining?
I was told you were a staked claim; I don't see any sign of a title.
But you do like having Doran around.
He's our foreman.
He was your foreman. Last night's action earned him his promotion. Now you're not marrying the foreman, you're marrying the boss.
There's a lot you don't understand...
[Sherry glares at her brother]
... and a lot I don't!
If you want coffee, this is the place. If you want trouble, you better try the saloon. That's where Frank Emmett is.

[to Emmett]
Drink... then draw.
[last lines]
[after the shootout, Sherry hands Ross his horse's reins]
Thanks, Sherry.
